BitField.name: PDE
BitField.description: Enables the weak pulldowns on the USB transceiver.

Enum.description: Weak pulldowns are disabled on D+ and D-.
Weak pulldowns are enabled on D+ and D-.

BitField.name: SUSP
BitField.description: Places the USB transceiver into the suspend state.

Enum.description: USB transceiver is not in suspend state.
USB transceiver is in suspend state.

BitField.name: DMPD
BitField.description: Provides observability of the D- Pulldown enable at the USB transceiver.

Enum.description: D- pulldown disabled.
D- pulldown enabled.

BitField.name: DPPD
BitField.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pulldown enable at the USB transceiver.

Enum.description: D+ pulldown disabled.
D+ pulldown enabled.

BitField.name: DPPU
BitField.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pullup enable at the USB transceiver.

Enum.description: D+ pullup disabled.
D+ pullup enabled.

BitField.name: DPPULLUPNONOTG
BitField.description: Provides control of the DP Pullup in USBOTG, if USB is configured in non-OTG device mode.

Enum.description: DP Pullup in non-OTG device mode is not enabled.
DP Pullup in non-OTG device mode is enabled.
No interrupt was generated.
Interrupt was generated because of the USB asynchronous interrupt.
Synchronous interrupt has not been detected.
Synchronous interrupt has been detected.

BitField.name: USB_CLK_RECOVERY_INT
BitField.description: Combined USB Clock Recovery interrupt status

Enum.description: USB asynchronous wakeup from suspend mode disabled.

USB asynchronous wakeup from suspend mode enabled. The asynchronous resume interrupt differs from the synchronous resume interrupt in that it asynchronously detects K-state using the unfiltered state of the D+ and D- pins. This interrupt should only be enabled when the Transceiver is suspended.
Normal USB module operation.
Returns the USB module to its reset state.
Trim fine adjustment always works based on the previous updated trim fine value (default)
Trim fine restarts from the IFR trim value whenever bus_reset/bus_resume is detected or module enable is desasserted
Always works in tracking phase after the 1st time rough to track transition (default)
Go back to rough stage whenever bus reset or bus resume occurs
Disable clock recovery block (default)
Enable clock recovery block
IRC48M local regulator is disabled
IRC48M local regulator is enabled (default)
Disable the IRC48M module (default)
Enable the IRC48M module

BitField.name: OVF_ERROR
BitField.description: Indicates that the USB clock recovery algorithm has detected that the frequency trim adjustment needed for the IRC48M output clock is outside the available TRIM_FINE adjustment range for the IRC48M module

Enum.description: No interrupt is reported
Unmasked interrupt has been generated

RegisterGroup.name: CMP0
RegisterGroup.description: High-Speed Comparator (CMP), Voltage Reference (VREF) Digital-to-Analog Converter (DAC), and Analog Mux (ANMUX)

Enum.description: Level 0
Level 1
Level 2
Level 3
Filter is disabled. If SE = 1, then COUT is a logic 0. This is not a legal state, and is not recommended. If SE = 0, COUT = COUTA.
One sample must agree. The comparator output is simply sampled.
2 consecutive samples must agree.
3 consecutive samples must agree.
4 consecutive samples must agree.
5 consecutive samples must agree.
6 consecutive samples must agree.
7 consecutive samples must agree.
Analog Comparator is disabled.
Analog Comparator is enabled.
CMPO is not available on the associated CMPO output pin. If the comparator does not own the pin, this field has no effect.

CMPO is available on the associated CMPO output pin. The comparator output (CMPO) is driven out on the associated CMPO output pin if the comparator owns the pin. If the comparator does not own the field, this bit has no effect.
Set the filtered comparator output (CMPO) to equal COUT.
Set the unfiltered comparator output (CMPO) to equal COUTA.
Does not invert the comparator output.
Inverts the comparator output.
Low-Speed (LS) Comparison mode selected. In this mode, CMP has slower output propagation delay and lower current consumption.
High-Speed (HS) Comparison mode selected. In this mode, CMP has faster output propagation delay and higher current consumption.
Windowing mode is not selected.
Windowing mode is selected.
Sampling mode is not selected.
Sampling mode is selected.
Falling-edge on COUT has not been detected.
Falling-edge on COUT has occurred.
Rising-edge on COUT has not been detected.
Rising-edge on COUT has occurred.
Interrupt is disabled.
Interrupt is enabled.
Interrupt is disabled.
Interrupt is enabled.
DMA is disabled.
DMA is enabled.
V is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference V. in1 in
V is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference V. in2 in
DAC is disabled.
DAC is enabled.
Pass Through Mode is disabled.
Pass Through Mode is enabled.

BitField.name: PADEN
BitField.description: Enable Frame Padding Remove On Receive

Enum.description: No padding is removed on receive by the MAC.
Padding is removed from received frames.
Pause frames are terminated and discarded in the MAC.
Pause frames are forwarded to the user application.
The CRC field of received frames is transmitted to the user application.
The CRC field is stripped from the frame.

MAC control frames with any opcode other than 0x0001 (pause frame) are silently discarded.
The payload length check is disabled.
The core checks the frame's payload length with the frame length/type field. Errors are indicated in the EIR[PLC] field.
No PAUSE frame transmitted.
The MAC stops transmission of data frames after the current transmission is complete.

Enum.description: Indicates to the transmit data FIFO that the written frames contain two additional octets before the frame data. This means the actual frame begins at bit 16 of the first word written into the FIFO. This function allows putting the frame payload on a 32-bit boundary in memory, as the 14-byte Ethernet header is extended to a 16-byte header.

BitField.name: IPCHK
BitField.description: Enables insertion of IP header checksum.

Enum.description: Checksum is not inserted.
If an IP frame is transmitted, the checksum is inserted automatically. The IP header checksum field must be cleared. If a non-IP frame is transmitted the frame is not modified.
Checksum not inserted.
If an IP frame with a known protocol is transmitted, the checksum is inserted automatically into the frame. The checksum field must be cleared. The other frames are not modified.

BitField.name: PADREM
BitField.description: Enable Padding Removal For Short IP Frames

Enum.description: Padding not removed.
Any bytes following the IP payload section of the frame are removed from the frame.

BitField.name: IPDIS
BitField.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With Wrong IPv4 Header Checksum

Enum.description: Frames with wrong IPv4 header checksum are not discarded.

If an IPv4 frame is received with a mismatching header checksum, the frame is discarded. IPv6 has no header checksum and is not affected by this setting. Discarding is only available when the RX FIFO operates in store and forward mode (RSFL cleared).

BitField.name: PRODIS
BitField.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With Wrong Protocol Checksum

Enum.description: Frames with wrong checksum are not discarded.

If a TCP/IP, UDP/IP, or ICMP/IP frame is received that has a wrong TCP, UDP, or ICMP checksum, the frame is discarded. Discarding is only available when the RX FIFO operates in store and forward mode (RSFL cleared).

BitField.name: LINEDIS
BitField.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With MAC Layer Errors

Enum.description: Frames with errors are not discarded.
Any frame received with a CRC, length, or PHY error is automatically discarded and not forwarded to the user application interface.
Instructs the MAC to write two additional bytes in front of each frame received into the RX FIFO.

Enum.description: The timer stops at the current value.
The timer starts incrementing.

The timer can be reset to zero when the given offset time is reached (offset event). The field is cleared when the offset event is reached, so no further event occurs until the field is set again. The timer offset value must be set before setting this field.
The timer is not affected and no action occurs, besides clearing OFFEN, when the offset is reached.
If OFFEN is set, the timer resets to zero when the offset setting is reached. The offset event does not cause a timer interrupt.

A period event interrupt can be generated (EIR[TS_TIMER]) and the event signal output is asserted when the timer wraps around according to the periodic setting ATPER. The timer period value must be set before setting this bit. Not all devices contain the event signal output. See the chip configuration details.

BitField.name: PINPER
BitField.description: Enables event signal output assertion on period event

Enum.description: No effect.
The current time is captured and can be read from the ATVR register.
The timer is active and all configuration fields in this register are relevant.

The internal timer is disabled and the externally provided timer value is used. All other fields, except CAPTURE, in this register have no effect. CAPTURE can still be used to capture the current timer value.

BitField.name: DACBFRPBF
BitField.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Position Flag

Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer is not equal to C2[DACBFUP].
The DAC buffer read pointer is equal to C2[DACBFUP].

BitField.name: DACBFRPTF
BitField.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Position Flag

Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer is not zero.
The DAC buffer read pointer is zero.
The DAC buffer read pointer has not reached the watermark level.
The DAC buffer read pointer has reached the watermark level.

BitField.name: DACBBIEN
BitField.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Flag Interrupt Enable

Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer bottom flag interrupt is disabled.
The DAC buffer read pointer bottom flag interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: DACBTIEN
BitField.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Flag Interrupt Enable

Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer top flag interrupt is disabled.
The DAC buffer read pointer top flag interrupt is enabled.
The DAC buffer watermark interrupt is disabled.
The DAC buffer watermark interrupt is enabled.
High-Power mode
Low-Power mode
The DAC soft trigger is not valid.
The DAC soft trigger is valid.
The DAC hardware trigger is selected.
The DAC software trigger is selected.
The DAC selects DACREF_1 as the reference voltage.
The DAC selects DACREF_2 as the reference voltage.
The DAC system is disabled.
The DAC system is enabled.
Buffer read pointer is disabled. The converted data is always the first word of the buffer.
Buffer read pointer is enabled. The converted data is the word that the read pointer points to. It means converted data can be from any word of the buffer.
Normal mode
Swing mode
One-Time Scan mode
1 word
2 words
3 words
4 words
DMA is disabled.
DMA is enabled. When DMA is enabled, the DMA request will be generated by original interrupts. The interrupts will not be presented on this module at the same time.

BitField.name: DATA0
BitField.description: When the DAC buffer is not enabled, DATA[11:0] controls the output voltage based on the following formula: V out = V in * (1 + DACDAT0[11:0])/4096 When the DAC buffer is enabled, DATA is mapped to the 16-word buffer

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: Disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses.

Enum.description: there are preempted active exceptions to execute
there are no active exceptions, or the currently-executing exception is the only active exception

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

Enum.description: Will not service
Will service a pending exception
no effect
removes the pending state from the SysTick exception
write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending
write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending
no effect
removes the pending state from the PendSV exception
write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending
write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending
write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending
write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

Register.name: SCB_AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

Enum.description: no system reset request
asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

BitField.name: PRIGROUP
BitField.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority.

Enum.description: o not sleep when returning to Thread mode
enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR
deep sleep
only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded
enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor
processor can enter Thread mode only when no exception is active
processor can enter Thread mode from any level under the control of an EXC_RETURN value

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

Enum.description: do not trap unaligned halfword and word accesses
trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

Enum.description: do not trap divide by 0
trap divide by 0

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or -2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions.

Enum.description: data bus faults caused by load and store instructions cause a lock-up
handlers running at priority -1 and -2 ignore data bus faults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

Enum.description: 4-byte aligned
8-byte aligned

BitField.name: PRI_15
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

Register.name: SCB_SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

A bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BFAR holds a valid fault address

forced HardFault

BitField.name: AUXFAULT
BitField.description: Latched version of the AUXFAULT inputs

Enum.description: Access denied. Any attempted access generates a NOCP UsageFault
Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP fault.
Reserved. The result of any access is UNPREDICTABLE.
Full access.
Access denied. Any attempted access generates a NOCP UsageFault
Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP fault.
Reserved. The result of any access is UNPREDICTABLE.
Full access.
Lazy state preservation is not active.
Lazy state preservation is active. floating-point stack frame has been allocated but saving state to it has been deferred.

BitField.name: USER
BitField.description: Privilege level when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.description: Privilege level was not user when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.
Privilege level was user when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: THREAD
BitField.description: Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.description: Mode was not Thread Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.
Mode was Thread Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: HFRDY
BitField.description: Permission to set the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.description: Priority did not permit setting the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.
Priority permitted setting the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: MMRDY
BitField.description: Permission to set the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.description: MemManage is disabled or priority did not permit setting the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.
MemManage is enabled and priority permitted setting the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: BFRDY
BitField.description: Permission to set the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.description: BusFault is disabled or priority did not permit setting the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.
BusFault is disabled or priority did not permit setting the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: MONRDY
BitField.description: Permission to set the MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.description: DebugMonitor is disabled or priority did not permit setting MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.
DebugMonitor is enabled and priority permits setting MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: LSPEN
BitField.description: Lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

Enum.description: Disable automatic lazy state preservation for floating-point context.
Enable automatic lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

BitField.name: ASPEN
BitField.description: Enables CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction. This results in automatic hardware state preservation and restoration, for floating-point context, on exception entry and exit.

Enum.description: Disable CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction.
Enable CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction.

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame.

BitField.name: RMode
BitField.description: Default value for FPSCR.RMode (Rounding Mode control field).

Enum.description: Round to Nearest (RN) mode
Round towards Plus Infinity (RP) mode.
Round towards Minus Infinity (RM) mode.
Round towards Zero (RZ) mode.

BitField.name: FZ
BitField.description: Default value for FPSCR.FZ (Flush-to-zero mode control bit).

Enum.description: Flush-to-zero mode disabled. Behavior of the floating-point system is fully compliant with the IEEE 754 standard.
Flush-to-zero mode enabled.

BitField.name: DN
BitField.description: Default value for FPSCR.DN (Default NaN mode control bit).

Enum.description: NaN operands propagate through to the output of a floating-point operation.
Any operation involving one or more NaNs returns the Default NaN.

BitField.name: AHP
BitField.description: Default value for FPSCR.AHP (Alternative half-precision control bit).

Enum.description: IEEE half-precision format selected.
Alternative half-precision format selected.
counter disabled
counter enabled
counting down to 0 does not assert the SysTick exception request
counting down to 0 asserts the SysTick exception request
external clock
processor clock

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SysTick Current Value Register when the counter reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: Current value at the time the register is accessed

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value to use for 10ms timing

Enum.description: 10ms calibration value is exact
10ms calibration value is inexact, because of the clock frequency
The reference clock is provided
The reference clock is not provided

BitField.name: INTID
BitField.description: Interrupt ID of the interrupt to trigger, in the range 0-239. For example, a value of 0x03 specifies interrupt IRQ3.

BitField.name: ASC
BitField.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is present

BitField.name: AMC
BitField.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.

Enum.description: A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is absent
A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is present

BitField.name: INTLINESNUM
BitField.description: The total number of interrupt lines supported by an implementation, defined in groups of 32.

BitField.name: DISMCYCINT
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables interruption of load multiple and store multiple instructions

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISFOLD
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISFPCA
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables IT folding

BitField.name: DISOOFP
BitField.description: Disables floating pointinstructions completing outof order with respect to integer instructions

BitField.name: RETTOBASE
BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA
BitField.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIVor UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or-2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

BitField.name: MUNSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: MSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: MLSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: MMARVALID
BitField.description: MemManage Fault Address Register(MMFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: UNSTKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: STKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: LSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: INVPC
BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, causedby an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

BitField.name: VECTTBL
BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vectortable read during exception processing

BitField.name: FORCED
BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handled, either because of priority or because it is disabled

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the MMARVALID bit of the MMFSR is set to 1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the MemManage fault

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the BFARVALID bit of the BFSR is set to1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the BusFault

BitField.name: IMPDEF
BitField.description: Implementation defined, the bits map to the AUXFAULT input signals

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame
